Message.Title: NTWK $6.45...Easy Double after Monster Earnings 11/14....Huge Preannouncement: Record Fiscal 1Q 2013 of $11M Revenues Will Beat 1Q 2012 by Over 60%!!!..... 20c/share net income in 1Q 2013 vs. 30c/share loss in 1Q 2012.......Guidance for 2013 is strong with 30 - 40% revenue growth and $1/share net income.....Cloud Divisions growing exponentially........4M share float
Message.Msg: Target: $10+ after Fiscal 1Q 2013 Earnings Release November 14, 2012 NTWK went from $15 to $45/share in a few weeks in 2007 on 100% lower revenues than in 2012 per guidance NTWK is a global software company with presence in all continents and No. 1 in China and South East Asia in the area of easing and financing software....Legacy and Cloud Analysts recently increased their average target price to $16 and max to $21/share (after record 4Q 2012 earnings and the 3rd consecutive strong quarter in a row) -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- . Today's Pre- Announcement: NetSol Technologies Expects Record First Quarter Revenue - Total Preliminary Revenue Expected in the Range of $10 to $11 Million - To Hold Fiscal 2013 First Quarter Results Conference Call on November 14 CALABASAS, Calif., Oct. 31, 2012 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- NetSol Technologies, Inc. (NTWK), a worldwide provider of global IT and enterprise application solutions, today provided preliminary revenue results for the first quarter ended September 30, 2012. Preliminary revenue results indicate the company's strongest first quarter ever, with revenue expected in the range of $10 million to $11 million. --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Pre-earnings implications: - The $11 million expected Fiscal 1Q 2013 revenue will yield 20 -30c/share net income. In 1Q 2012 the company reported 6.2 million in revenues and 30c/share loss. - Strongest 1Q ever - 4th Quarter or significant Y/Y improvements in top and bottom lines - 1Q 2013 Revenues are in line with the $48 million revenue projection for fiscal 2013 or 40% higher than 2012. - Projected $1/share net income (current guidance) will probably be exceeded - Company will likely increase guidance for 2013 because 1Q is always the weakest quarter. --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- An analyst covering the stock recently upped its earnings projections for NTWK based on significant increased global demand for all of its software products and services (legacy and cloud) Selected Analyst Comments: All business lines are very strong growth across the board. Significant demand for all legacy and cloud products. NTWK is entering FY13 with a $25 million backlog and approximately $100 million in qualified leads. One quarter of the backlog is from four new NFS platform customer implementations that began in 4Q12. Regarding the fast-growing high margin Cloud Divisions: The new Vroozi Cloud Division contributed $1.3 million in FY12. We expect at least $4 million in FY13 and $6 million to FY14 NTWK is entering FY13 with a $25 million backlog and approximately $100 million in qualified leads. One quarter of the backlog is from four new NFS platform customer implementations that began in 4Q12. In August 2011, NetSol launched its Cloud Vroozi Division, an e-procurement search tool for SAP supplier relationship management (SRM) users. SAP AG is a global vendor of enterprise management systems that has the largest market share (24%) based on a worldwide Gartner survey. Vroozi should provide sales diversification and a higher margin recurring revenue stream. The Vroozi division contributed $1.3 million in FY12 sales and is expected to grow to $4 million in revenues in 2013 NTWK announced its 2nd Cloud Division last week offering an array of products and services to capture a greater % of the cloud applications in North America. The company is implementing this division using their significant software development capabilities and infrastructure. --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- MORE NTWK HIGHLIGHTS: - Company projects Doubling/Tripling revenues and net income by 2015 - Significant Institutional investor ownership and growing - Insiders bought over 5% of the Outstanding shares the last 2 years and never sold a single share - Total share count is only 7.5 million shares. The float is only 3 million shares - Trading at forward PE of 5 - Strong balance sheet with $1.5/share cash - Has global agreement with Mercedes Benz - Already 7 countries with NTWK software for leasing and financing Mercedes Benz/Daimler including China, India, Japan, and others - No.1 in China and APAC in leasing/financing software products and services. NTWK has over 50 Fortune 100 loyal customers. Never lost a customer. None of the customers is over 5% of the total revenues - partial customer list: CitiGroup, Mercedes Benz, Santander, BMW, Volvo, Ford, GE Capital, Cisco Capital, Paribas, GMAC, Volvo, Toyota, Nissan, Hyundai, BYD, SANY Corp. China, etc. About NTWK: NetSol Technologies, Inc. ((NASDAQ: NTWK) is a worldwide provider of global IT and enterprise application solutions that include credit and finance portfolio management systems, SAP consulting and services, custom development, systems integration, and technical services for the global Financial, Leasing, Insurance, Energy, and Technology markets. Headquartered in Calabasas, Calif., NetSol's product and services offerings have achieved ISO 9001, ISO 20000, ISO 27001, and SEI (Software Engineering Institute) CMMI (Capability Maturity Model) Maturity Level 5 assessments, a distinction shared by only 178 companies worldwide. The company's clients include Fortune 500 manufacturers, global automakers, financial institutions, utilities, technology providers, and government agencies. NetSol has delivery and support locations in San Francisco, London, Beijing, Bangkok, Lahore, Adelaide and Riyadh.

Message.Title: Tax-free online shopping – is it coming to an end?
Message.Msg: There are three online sales tax bills before Congress at the present time. They include the Marketplace Fairness Act in the Senate, the Marketplace Equity Act in the House of Representatives and the Main Street Fairness Act in both the House and Senate. Oddly enough these bills are drumming up support from both parties most in part due to the fact that more sales tax would be collected which in turn provides more funding for libraries, parks, police and fire departments, and services for children and elderly. You may ask, ” why it would drum up more revenue?” The reason being is this: when you have tax-free online shopping the retailer is not collecting sales tax, therefore they are not liable to remit any sales tax. This burden lies on the consumer who purchases the item tax-free. They are the ones who are supposed to track each item bought tax-free and remit sales tax to the state for these purchases. This means that consumers who purchase items tax-free over the internet can be audited and charged penalties for failing to pay sales taxes. However, this hardly ever happens due to the states lacking the resources to chase down taxes for every single on-line purchase. The three bills have a similar focus but also have their differences but taken as a whole they would bring some order to a nationwide system of taxing jurisdictions. The new bills would not change states over to one universal tax rate, but rather a more streamlined process. The bills would also bring a more level playing field between on-line retailers and the small business owners with physical storefronts. If the on-line retailers are going to be forced to charge sales tax it does not give the unfair advantage of a lower price than at the brick-and-mortar store. We expect to hear more on each bill post-election day at the earliest. By: Amy Slates, CPA

If negativity all sounds incredibly stupid and repetetive it only can help the long side. likely will go higher short term, way down longterm if they miss. and the way they are pricing black friday,etc, i wouldn't be surprised to see a big holiday miss, but these inst. Traders are keep a straight up prop at 232.5, maybe to defend november options. I closed up my short hoping for a better spot since I wasn't making any money on the miss and tape read. There will come a day where the longs will get tired of amzn not making money and having a 3000 pe, but with market internals looking a tiny bit healthier today, shorts could find a better spot than 232. It is a dog, but one with wings.

Topic.Title: I agree that amzn is ridiculously overvalued...but the relentless negative posts about this company...

Message.Msg: Institutional INVESTORS are selling this as fast as they can without tanking it. Traders are trying to prop it up to scalp premium. Traders are going to end up losing because the longs will gladly keep selling something that should have been cut in half. Then, when traders try to tank it, longs will buy and manage the descent. The biggest short interest is in INTC and similar companies.... The rotation has already happened and momentum chasers have been caught wrong footed... Only China is really in a position to grow consumption. People have not yet begun to comprehend the profound negative feedback loops that Sandy will unleash on the domestic economy. It was already headed for significant contraction, but soon enough people will understand that we were on a tipping point... I strongly encourage any of you long AMZN to sell and buy INTC. You'll understand by the end of next year. INTC and GOOG are the best domestic tail hedges that exist.
And the soup kitchen is open too.... All is right in my world.

Message.Title: Was it artificial buying pressure or selling pressure?
Message.Msg: What kept this stock locked at $232 on a non-expiration day at a non-strike value? Was it artificial buying pressure to keep the stock above $232? Was it artificial selling pressure to keep the stock below $232? With every major news outlet (alpha, motley, FM, even Cramer) questioning AMZN now, it has to be option #1: artificial buying pressure. The way it closed was the key. People just selling stock don't care what the price is, they just want out and they sell -- so the fact that AMZN went down on an up-day today means that the selling pressure today was the natural tendency of market participants. It was artificial buying pressure that kept it above $232. People who need the stock at or above $232 (for some mysterious reason) need it to CLOSE above $232. And like clockwork, look what happened in the last 5 minutes of trading. What happens when the artificial buying pressure evaporates? Maybe some whale out there has stated that if AMZN goes below $232 that he's out, and so the $ mgrs keep the thing afloat. As soon as one big institution starts to leave, it's "Katie bar the door" and a race to the bottom. In the market, truth doesn't matter -- only perception, and nowhere is that clearer than AMZN. A few weeks ago Cramer liked it as a momentum stock, but now even he has changed his mind. Even Cramer warned that holding a stock when its momentum fizzles is a BAD thing. What kind of person looks at AMZN and does not perceive huge problems with its valuation? The perception of market participants is obviously changing and this thing is the next in a long line of overvalued bubbles to burst. Good news for longs though: you can use this manipulation to unload your positions without taking too much of a loss. GEEG, you too can make money on AMZN. I hope you're buying protective puts if you stay long, but now is the time to short this thing. I wish people believed in me like you believe in AMZN, but there comes a point, my man, when you just gotta change your mind about some things.
